pageContent: Background: Cryosurgery was first used to treat prostate cancer in the early 1970s but it was not until 1993, when the results from percutaneous ultrasound-guided cryosurgery were published, that the potential advantages of this treatment became apparent. Changes in equipment and techniques have improved the results of cryosurgery, in both tumor control and lower morbidity.

metaData.source:
Localized prostate cancer: can we better define who is at risk of unfavourable outcome?
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/18307686/
